question: In some countries, children are engaged in some kind of paid work. Some people rergad this as completely wrong, while others consider it as valuable work experience, important learning and taking responsiblities?
text: Write both view and your opinion

There is no doubt that even today, child labour is so evident. Even though  it is sometimes thought that the young generation would benefit from this if they start working at their tender age, others consider this ought to be criminalised. In my opinion, I firmly believe that  the later is correct as this work may have huge repercussions on one' s life.

On the one hand, advocates of  recruiting kids for any employment argue that this may allow them to have hands-on - experience, which can be an asset for their future career. In other words, they can develop skills and that can be utilized when they become adult. For example, in some countries, they encourage children to work in certain  job sectors, on the basis of scientific evidence. This exposure may sharpen they are fine motor and brain skills. Additionally, they could earn some money and use to buy things, which may not be possible otherwise.

However, on the other hand, opponents of the above- said viewpoint think that exposing the young one to a  working atmosphere  can be harmful and I support this statement. This is because they may be exploited by their employer by giving minimum wage for their hard work. Apart from this, kids may encounter dangerous scenarios, which may not be possible for them to handle. Eventually, they end up in  a working place, where the safety is minimum. For instance, this is the reason, in many developing countries, like India, where employing under 16 year is considered as an offence and penalise those who are responsible for the same.

In conclusion, people have various opinion whether is beneficial to employ kids or not. BY viewing both sides, I personally support to disqualify them to possess for any employment until they reach 18 years.
